descriptionSet.description: On this advertisement for the German beer brand Beck's, a man can be seen sitting in a chair, reading a book entitled "Tiny Tots' Tales" and enjoying a glass of Beck's beer.

inscription.text: Tiny Tots' Tales [inscription on book cover in the illustration]
Beck's Beer has been shipped to India and the East since 1873.
Agents: Spencer & Co., Ltd. - Madras - Calcutta - Bombay - Karachi - Delhi - etc. Cargills Ltd. - Colombo. Trading Company late Hegi & Co., Ltd. - Rangoon

description-en: On this advertisement for the German beer brand Beck's, a man can be seen sitting in a chair, reading a book entitled "Tiny Tots' Tales" and enjoying a glass of Beck's beer. (gs/ja)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: A deep-seated traditional social aversion to alcohol consumption has been a traditional feature of the Indian society. However, as urban consumers become more exposed to western lifestyles, through overseas travel and the media, their attitude towards alcohol is relaxing. Social habits are undergoing a transformation as mixed drinks are becoming more popular. The greatest evidence of this trend is the increase in beer consumption among women. More and more women are consuming beer â the penetration in metropolitan areas is almost twice as high as the penetration in other large cities â implying that the greater tolerance towards alcohol consumption in metropolitan areas facilitates the consumption of beer. With increasing urbanisation, this acceptance is only going to rise. (gs)
